chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (e : expr) (l : seq R) (n : nat), let '(a, b) := D e n in interp_domain l (simplify_domain b) -> is_derive (fun x : R_AbsRing => interp (set_nth R0 l n x) e) (nth R0 l n) (interp l a)

Premises:
Notation seq := list
simplify_domain = fix simplify_domain (d : domain) : domain := match d with | And ld => let l := foldr (fun (d0 : domain) (acc : seq domain) => let d' := simplify_domain d0 in match d' with | Never => [:: Never] | Always => acc | And l => l ++ acc | _ => d' :: acc end) [::] ld in match l with | [::] => Always | [:: d0] => d0 | [:: d0, _ & _] => And l end | Forall e1 e2 d0 => let d' := simplify_domain d0 in match d' with | Never => Never | Always => Always | _ => Forall e1 e
*** [ R0 : R ]
Inductive expr : Type := Var : nat -> expr | AppExt : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> seq expr -> expr | AppExtD : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> nat -> seq expr -> expr | App : expr -> expr -> expr | Subst : expr -> expr -> expr | Cst : R -> expr | Binary : bop -> expr -> expr -> expr | Unary : uop -> expr -> expr | Int : expr -> expr -> expr -> expr For Var: Argument scope is [nat_scope] For AppExt: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ list_scope] For AppExtD: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ nat_scope list_scope] For Cst: Argument scope is [R_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
interp = fix interp (l : seq R) (e : expr) {struct e} : R := match e with | Var n => nth R0 l n | AppExt k f le => apply k f (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | AppExtD k f n le => Derive_Rn k f n (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | App e1 e2 => interp (interp l e2 :: l) e1 | Subst e1 e2 => interp (set_nth R0 l 0 (interp l e2)) e1 | Cst c => c | Binary o e1 e2 => match o with | Eplus => Rplus | Emult =>
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
set_nth : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T -> seq T
is_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) (l : V) => filterdiff f (locally x) (fun y : K => scal y l) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> V -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _ _]
interp_domain = fix interp_domain (l : seq R) (d : domain) {struct d} : Prop := match d with | Never => False | Always => True | Partial p e => p (interp l e) | Derivable n k f le => ex_derive_Rn k f n (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | Derivable2 m n k f le => let le' := [seq interp l i | i <- le] in locally_2d (fun u v : R => ex_derive_Rn k f m (fun i : nat => if ssrnat.eqn i m then u else if ssrnat.eqn i n then v else nth 0 le' i)) (nth 
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ list_scope nat_scope]
R_AbsRing = AbsRing.Pack R {| AbsRing.base := {| Ring.base := R_AbelianGroup_mixin; Ring.mixin := R_Ring_mixin |}; AbsRing.mixin := R_AbsRing_mixin |} R : AbsRing
D = fix D (e : expr) (n : nat) {struct e} : expr * domain := match e with | Var v => (if ssrnat.eqn v n then Cst 1 else Cst 0, Always) | AppExt k f le => let lnc := index_not_const le n in let ld := [seq D e0 n | e0 <- le] in match lnc with | [::] => (Cst 0, Always) | [:: v1] => let '(d1, d2) := nth (Cst 0, Never) ld v1 in (Binary Emult d1 (AppExtD k f v1 le), And [:: Derivable v1 k f le;
D_correct : forall (e : expr) (l : seq R) (n : nat), let '(a, b) := D e n in interp_domain l b -> is_derive (fun x : R_AbsRing => interp (set_nth R0 l n x) e) (nth R0 l n) (interp l a)
is_const_correct : forall (e : expr) (n : nat), is_const e n = true -> forall (l : seq R) (x1 x2 : R), interp (set_nth 0 l n x1) e = interp (set_nth 0 l n x2) e
interp_set_nth : forall (n : nat) (l : seq R) (e : expr), interp (set_nth 0 l n (nth 0 l n)) e = interp l e
interp_domain_set_nth : forall (n : nat) (l : seq R) (b : domain), interp_domain (set_nth 0 l n (nth 0 l n)) b < -> interp_domain l b
interp_AppExt_set_nth_not_const : forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr) (l : seq R) (n : nat) (x : R), interp (set_nth 0 l n x) (AppExt k f le) = apply k f (foldr (fun (v : nat) (acc : nat -> R) (i : nat) => if ssrnat.eqn i v then interp (set_nth 0 l n x) (nth (Cst 0) le v) else acc i) (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) (index_not_const le n))
index_not_const_correct : forall (n : nat) (l : seq expr) (k : nat), ~ k \in index_not_const l n -> is_const (nth (Cst 0) l k) n = true
simplify_domain_correct : forall (d : domain) (l : seq R), interp_domain l (simplify_domain d) -> interp_domain l d
foldr_prop_nth : forall (d : ?T) (l : seq ?T) (n : nat), foldr (fun (d0 : ?T) (acc : Prop) => ?P d0 /\ acc) True l -> ?P d -> ?P (nth d l n) where ?T : [ |- Type] ?P : [ |- ?T -> Prop]
is_derive_unique : forall (f : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing) (l : R_NormedModule), is_derive f x l -> Derive f x = l
uniq_index_not_const : forall (n : nat) (l : seq expr), uniq (index_not_const l n)
is_derive_inv : forall (f : R -> R) (x l : R), is_derive f x l -> f x <> 0 -> is_derive (fun y : R => / f y) x (- l / f x ^ 2)
is_derive_Reals : forall (f : R -> R) (x l : R), is_derive f x l < -> derivable_pt_lim f x l
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : seq A -> Prop), P [::] -> (forall (a : A) (l : seq A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : seq A, P l
index_not_const = fun (l : seq expr) (n : nat) => [seq v <- iota 0 (size l) | ~~ is_const (nth (Cst 0) l v) n] : seq expr -> nat -> seq nat Argument scopes are [list_scope nat_scope]
is_derive_ext : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (l : ?V), (forall t : ?K, f t = g t) -> is_derive f x l -> is_derive g x l where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
RField_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : seq R) (lpe : seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp IZR N.to_nat pow l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp IZR N.to_nat pow l pe2
domain_ind' : forall P : domain -> Prop, P Never -> P Always -> (forall (p : R -> Prop) (e : expr), P (Partial p e)) -> (forall (n k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr), P (Derivable n k f le)) -> (forall (m n k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr), P (Derivable2 m n k f le)) -> (forall (n : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous n e)) -> (forall (m n : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous2 m n e)) -> (forall f e1 e2 : expr, P (Integrable f e1 e2)) ->...-> forall d : domain, P d
is_derive_opp : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (l : ?V), is_derive f x l -> is_derive (fun x0 : ?K => opp (f x0)) x (opp l) where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
is_derive_RInt_param : forall (f : R_AbsRing -> R -> R_NormedModule) (a b : R) (x : AbsRing_UniformSpace R_AbsRing), locally x (fun x0 : AbsRing_UniformSpace R_AbsRing => forall t : R, Rmin a b <= t <= Rmax a b -> ex_derive (fun u : R_AbsRing => f u t) x0) ->...-> is_derive (fun x0 : R_AbsRing => RInt (fun t : R => f x0 t) a b) x (RInt (fun t : R => Derive (fun u : R => f u t) x) a b)
nth_set_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat) (y : T), ssrfun.eqfun (nth x0 (set_nth x0 s n y)) (ssrfun.fun_of_simpl (ssrfun.SimplFunDelta (fun _ : eqtype.Equality.sort ssrnat.nat_eqType => eqtype.app_fdelta (eqtype.FunDelta (aT:=ssrnat.nat_eqType) n y) (nth x0 s))))
interp_ext : forall (l1 l2 : seq R) (e : expr), (forall k : nat, nth 0 l1 k = nth 0 l2 k) -> interp l1 e = interp l2 e
expr_ind' : forall P : expr -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (Var n)) -> (forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr), foldr (fun (e : expr) (acc : Prop) => P e /\ acc) True le -> P (AppExt k f le)) -> (forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (n : nat) (le : seq expr), foldr (fun (e : expr) (acc : Prop) => P e /\ acc) True le -> P (AppExtD k f n le)) -> (forall e1 e2 : expr, P e1 -> P e2 -> P (App e1 e2)) ->...-> forall e : expr, P e
nth_default : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (size s) n -> nth x0 s n = x0
ex_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) => exists l : V, is_derive f x l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
andP = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 as b return (reflect (b /\ b2) (b && b2)) then if b2 as b return (reflect (true /\ b) (true && b)) then ReflectT (true /\ true) (conj is_true_true is_true_true) else ReflectF (true /\ false) (fun __top_assumption_ : true /\ false => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (a : true) (b : false), (fun _ : true /\ false => False) (conj a b) => match __top_assumption_ as a return ((fun _ : true /\ false => False) a) with | conj x x0 => _evar_0_ x x0 end) (fun (_ : true) (b : false) => let H : False := eq_ind false (fun e : bool =>...
nth_map : forall (T1 : Type) (x1 : T1) (T2 : Type) (x2 : T2) (f : T1 -> T2) (n : nat) (s : seq T1), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x2 [seq f i | i <- s] n = f (nth x1 s n)
is_const = fix is_const (e : expr) (n : nat) {struct e} : bool := match e with | Var v => ~~ ssrnat.eqn v n | AppExt _ _ le => foldr (fun (v : expr) (acc : bool) => is_const v n && acc) true le | AppExtD _ _ _ _ => false | App f e0 => is_const f (S n) && is_const e0 n | Subst f e0 => (ssrnat.eqn n 0 || is_const f n) && is_const e0 n | Cst _ => true | Binary _ e1 e2 => is_const e1 n && is_const e2 n | Unary _ e0 => is_const e0 n | Int f e1 e2 => [&& is_const f (S n), is_const e1 n & is_const...
IZR = fun z : Z => match z with | 0%Z => R0 | Z.pos n => IPR n | Z.neg n => - IPR n end : Z -> R Argument scope is [Z_scope]
nth_map' : forall (x1 : ?T1) (T2 : Type) (f : ?T1 -> T2) (n : nat) (s : seq ?T1), nth (f x1) [seq f i | i <- s] n = f (nth x1 s n) where ?T1 : [ |- Type]
is_derive_RInt_param_bound_comp_aux2 : forall (f : R -> R -> R) (a : R -> R) (b x da : R), locally x (fun y : R => ex_RInt (fun t : R => f y t) (a x) b) -> (exists eps : posreal, locally x (fun y : R => ex_RInt (fun t : R => f y t) (a x - eps) (a x + eps))) -> is_derive a x da ->...-> is_derive (fun x0 : R => RInt (fun t : R => f x0 t) (a x0) b) x (RInt (fun t : R => Derive (fun u : R => f u t) x) (a x) b + - f x (a x) * da)
